name: Gulyás
short_description: A staple of Hungarian cuisine, gulyás boasts tender beef simmered in a vibrant paprika broth, enriched with sweet bell peppers, hearty potatoes, and aromatic spices. Each bowl warms the soul with its rustic charm.

name: Krémes
short_description: Originating from Hungary, krémes enchants with its delicate layers of flaky puff pastry and velvety pastry cream, infused with vanilla. A sweet indulgence that's both creamy and crisp, it's a beloved treat in Hungarian bakeries.

name: Chicken paprikash (Paprikás csirke)
short_description: Originating from Hungary, this rustic stew features tender chicken braised with sweet paprika and onions, creating a rich, comforting dish. Served with egg noodles, it embodies the heart of traditional Hungarian cuisine.

name: Pörkölt
short_description: Hungary's beloved national stew, Pörkölt, features tender meats like beef, lamb, and pork, simmered in a rich, smoky red sauce with bell peppers. Its deep flavors reflect the heart of Hungarian cuisine.

name: Lecsó
short_description: Hearty and vibrant, this traditional Hungarian ragout features sautéed onions, bell peppers, and ripe tomatoes, all infused with rich paprika and lard. A comforting taste of Hungarian home cooking!

name: Pogácsa
short_description: A beloved Hungarian treat, these flaky, golden pastries are often filled with cheese, bacon, or herbs. Best enjoyed warm, Pogácsa offers a delightful burst of savory flavors in every bite.

name: Lángos
short_description: Deep-fried to a perfect golden-brown, this Hungarian street snack features a soft, pillowy dough. Topped with tangy sour cream or yogurt, it offers a delightful blend of flavors and cultural charm.

name: Dobostorta
short_description: A Hungarian classic, this elegant cake features six delicate sponge layers interspersed with rich chocolate buttercream. Its signature caramel topping offers a delightful crunch, making each bite a heavenly experience.

name: Spit cake (Kürtőskalács)
short_description: Originating from medieval Székely Land, this delightful chimney cake features a golden, crispy exterior dusted with cinnamon sugar, revealing a soft, fluffy center that’s irresistibly sweet.

name: Kifli
short_description: Crescent-shaped and delightfully soft, these Hungarian yeast rolls are enriched with butter and eggs, then topped with aromatic poppy and caraway seeds. Perfectly enjoyed plain or with a sweet spread, they embody Hungary's rich baking tradition.

name: Töltött kaposzta
short_description: Hungarian tradition shines through tender cabbage leaves filled with a savory blend of minced pork, rice, and aromatic spices. Slow-cooked to perfection, each roll offers a comforting taste of home.

name: Esterházy torta
short_description: Originating from 19th-century Budapest, this elegant cake layers almond meringue and rich buttercream infused with vanilla and cocoa, creating a delightful harmony of flavors fit for royalty.

name: Hurka
short_description: Savor the rich flavors of Hungary with hurka, a beloved sausage featuring ground pork, liver, and aromatic onions. Enjoy its hearty combination in both májas and véres varieties, reflecting local culinary traditions.

name: Húsleves
short_description: Hearty and comforting, this traditional Hungarian soup combines tender beef or chicken with silky noodles and sweet root vegetables. A beloved staple, it warms the soul with every savory spoonful.

name: Főzelék
short_description: A beloved Hungarian staple, this thick vegetable stew combines the earthy flavors of cabbage, green peas, and lentils, creating a comforting dish served warm. Perfect for a hearty meal, it's both nutritious and satisfying.

name: Halászlé
short_description: A beloved staple from the banks of the Tisza River, this spicy fisherman's soup features a medley of catfish, pike, and carp, simmered in a rich, paprika-infused broth for a warming delight.

name: Zserbó
short_description: Layered and luscious, this chocolate-topped delight features rich apricot jam and crunchy walnuts, celebrating Hungarian pastry tradition since its creation by Swiss chocolatier Émile Gerbeaud.

name: Rakott krumpli
short_description: Layers of tender potatoes, smoky Csabai kolbász, crispy bacon, and creamy eggs come together in this beloved Hungarian casserole. A true comfort food, it delights with every savory bite.

name: Kalács
short_description: Hungarian kalács delights with its rich, buttery flavor and soft, pillowy texture. Often braided and slightly sweetened, it’s a beloved staple at family gatherings and festive occasions.

name: Túrógombóc
short_description: Delicate dumplings made from creamy cottage cheese and semolina are rolled in breadcrumbs and lightly fried to golden perfection. A beloved treat from Hungary's culinary tradition, they offer a delightful balance of textures and flavors.

name: Meggyleves
short_description: Chilled and refreshing, this traditional Hungarian sweet soup blends tart sour cherries with creamy sour cream, accented by warm spices like cloves and star anise. Perfect for summer!

name: Somlói galuska
short_description: Originating from Hungary, this indulgent trifle cake layers fluffy sponge, rich custard, and chocolate, all interspersed with rum-soaked raisins for a delightful burst of flavor.

name: Túrós csusza
short_description: Nestled in Hungary's culinary heritage, túrós csusza features rolled, flat egg pasta tossed with creamy túró cheese and topped with crispy bacon bits, creating a delightful blend of savory flavors.

name: Gesztenyepüré
short_description: Puréed chestnuts, subtly sweetened and infused with rum and vanilla, create a luxurious dessert that’s a Hungarian favorite. Topped with airy whipped cream, it’s a delightful nod to culinary history since 1475.
